name: Halibut with Lemon, Spinach, and Tomatoes
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter 1/2 cup chopped kalamata olives
2 (﴾10-‐ounce)﴿ bags baby spinach Fresh basil leaves, as garnish
steps: Salt and freshly ground pepper 1/2 cup olive oil
In a large saute pan over medium-‐high heat add the olive oil and heat. When oil is hot, place the halibut steaks in
pan and cook 3 to 4 minutes each side, or until a fork can be easily inserted into the fish. Season, to taste, with
salt, pepper and lemon juice. Remove from the heat and keep warm.
In another large saute pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and butter. Add the spinach gradually along with
the crushed garlic and salt. Saute until the spinach is wilted. Season, to taste, with lemon juice and pepper.
In a small saucepan combine the tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, salt, and kalamata olives. Heat quickly on high heat
so that the tomatoes do not turn into a sauce.
Put spinach in center of each plate then place the piece of halibut in the center of the spinach. Spoon the sauce
over the halibut and garnish with fresh basil
